page.title: 01 INTRODUCTION
page.content: {Wickford}is a town of approximately 26 000 people situated in South East Essex.{Basildon NewTown}lies 7kms to the South,{Chelmsford}17kms to the North-East and{Southend}12kms to the South-East.The smaller centres of {Billericay}and{Rayleigh}lie about 6kms West and East of{Wickford}respectively {.Wickford}is centred on the badly drained Cr ouch valley,the housing being built largely on the land sloping away from the river.Most of the land is below 20m,the highest point being 38m,near Doeshill farm.The geological succession consists of London clay overlain by Bagshot and Claygate beds on the higher ground.There are deposits of solifluxion gravels and alluvium in the Crouch valley which can be seen exposed in the Memorial Park.
